alert.note: Alert for Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 6:48AM EDT until August 06 at 10:30AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Southern Ripley County and Southern Dearborn County. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 647 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Lawrenceburg, Aurora, Versailles, Milan, Osgood, Dillsboro, Moores Hill, Wilmington, Holton, Olean, Friendship, Versailles Lake, Benham, Cross Plains, Farmers Retreat, Cold Springs, Rexville, New Marion and Mount Sinai.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
